intro: Rogiera urophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf rogeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
